entry.title: Story Report with Direct Reports AND Salary with Acting Pay
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to create a story report with a cross-tab table that shows both:

1. The number of direct reports each employee has. Only direct reports that have employee class = employee should be included.

2. A calculated value that shows the employee's annualized salary, as well as their annualized acting pay. These come from 2 different pay components which are then multiplied by the standard hours worked to get an annualized value. 

 

  • The direct reports field on the user entity cannot be used since there is no way to apply any filtering based on employee class. The direct report measure is a dimension count of the user ids in the direct report entity.
  • The annualized salary and annualized acting pay are calculated columns based on the 'Amount' field in recurring pay, restricted by pay component using an if statement. The aggregation for both columns is set to max. 
  • Both of the above measures work fine. The issue comes when calculating the annualized salary with acting pay: the annualized salary with acting pay is a calculated column that must have the aggregation value set to 'sum' rather than 'max' to show up properly in the table, as it is adding values that exist on different rows. 

Here is what the record set looks like prior to summarizing in a cross-tab: 

 

EmployeeDirect ReportEmployee Annual SalaryEmployee Annual Acting Pay
100-50000-
100--5000
10110250000-
101102--
10110350000-
101103--
10110450000-
101104--
10510650000-
105106-5000
10510750000-
105107-5000
10510850000-
105108-5000
  • Employee 100 has 0 direct reports and $5000 annual acting pay
  • Employee 101 has 3 direct reports and no acting pay
  • Employee 105 has 3 direct reports and $5000 annual acting pay

Here is what I want to show in the cross-tab: 

EmployeeDirect ReportsEmployee SalaryEmployee Acting PayEmployee Salary with Acting Pay
100-50000500055000
101350000050000
1053500005000

55000

Here is what actually shows in the cross-tab:

EmployeeDirect ReportsEmployee SalaryEmployee Acting PayEmployee Salary with Acting Pay
100-50000500055000
101350000050000
1053500005000165000

The salary with acting pay reports correctly for employee 100 and 101. The salary with acting pay shows up multiplied by the number of direct reports for the employee that has both direct reports and acting pay.

Does anyone have any ideas on how to resolve?

entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow LATAM - 2025, the First Half Recap, Being Present is About More Than Words.
entry.content:
Being present, is about more than words

So a few months ago back in April  I was chatting with my developer advocate colleague @ajmaradiaga about my new role as a Community Advocate and doing more outreach.  Attending more events in person specifically, and one type of event that we need to be present at is the SAP Inside Track (SIT's) and I was invited by the amazing team in Brazil that runs so many SIT events in Brazil. In particular I was asked to attend, and then asked to speak, and then speak twice, at the SIT in São Paulo.  The goal of this outreach was to have our team of Community Advocates be more present and listen and talk in person more, and not just online.  In talking about this plan with Developer Advocate Antonio Maradiaga he had a thought.   After the success of last years LATAM roadshow (that he and I did)  he said since he was going to do it again this year with a goal to visit a few cities they hadn't been to, Lima Peru and Mexico city, and also a repeat visit in Bogota.  But since I was going to be in São Paulo on a Saturday for the SIT and the encontro the day before (Antonio helped organize a local meetup called an encontro and @RobertaFernande picked a great spot) maybe I could host a #CodeJam there and then meet him and @RichHeilman the next week in Lima.  Of course I agreed and the plan was set to use the SAP office and have a GenAI CodeJam in São Paulo.

Being present, again and unintended effects:

Fast forward to SAP Sapphire in Orlando. I’m giving a presentation on community and also attending meetings with the SAP Mentors. In one meeting I’m next to @ChrisRae  and he says “mate, gotta head to an #Apphaus meeting, can you join?"

I say sure and follow him over.  Then when I walk in, I’m amazed to see a lot of faces in person that I’d been emailing with about growing the SAP Community presence at the Apphaus locations.  I say a few words and talk about how the team of Developer Advocates can host a CodeJam or I can have meetings at their space if they are willing to host.  All of the partners love this idea. Then a person came up at the end of the meeting named Renan Guedes. He said he runs the Apphaus in São Paulo and wanted me to visit when I was there. I said hey, why don’t I ask Antonio to move the CodeJam from our office to the Apphaus.

Apphaus meetinFirst time meeting Renan

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Pretty cool!  First half of the LATAM roadshow is set. 

  • CodeJam at the exec consulting Apphaus
  • Meetup at bar 
  • SIT São Paulo at the campus of PUC 
  • Then off to Lima for the next CodeJam and a quedada (meetup in español)
  • Bonus, I got a coffee with SAP Mentor @Raquel_PereiradaCunha me and Raquel

Being present, the reality

I land in Brazil. My colleague @SavioMarques10  agrees to pick me up and we can go to get a coffee then attend get to the CodeJam and setup early. Savio showing me the best coffee!

It’s a great space and the team at Exed Consulting are so gracious. They welcome our local attendees and we are off showcasing how to sue GenAI in BTP. I have great conversations in English as my Portuguese is, lacking. We even did a podcast!

Apphaus group photo

CodeJam in action

Then after we have gone through our 5-6 hours of content we break for day. I’m hopeful to see a few of the attendees at the meetup along with some of the SIT attendees who are already in town.  I’m blown away. We get about 25 people. Several form the CodeJams and several sit.  A few SAP Champions are there like @Marssel700 and I even get a present for the next day, a couple of shirts, SIT shirts. One even has my name.

SIT Shirts

 

encontro São Paulo

I’m not too tired but want to make sure I’m able to get some rest and prepare for my two sessions and also have great conversations so I head back to the hotel, which for some reason has blue stains on the pillow case?

I called this section “being present, the reality” but I had no idea just how many great conversations I would have. How many photos I would take with the attendees. Roberta  even made a Brazilian flat Josh!!!

Brazilian flat Josh, also taller than me

 

I give my presentation on the technical side of the conference. I have a great lunch with a few locals and then my colleague Savio makes sure I meetup with a new colleague I met at the CodeJams named Arthur who agrees to make sure if I need anything he’s there to help.  Everyone is so kind.  For those interested in a photo but don't want a 1-1 we meet at the court for a group photo!

 

My second presentation is great and the audience is very happy when I end with a slide stating “Vai Conrinthians!” and the logo of the local favorite football team (soccer to me…), that was my loudest applause and cheers of the day!

Group selfie at SIT São Paulo

 

We have a wrap up meal with several of the SIT organizers and then the next I'm off to Lima Peru where there are two code jams and a meetup Called a quedada locally.  Me and the crew meet in the hotel lobby to strategize!

 

gotta be on the blue crue!

 The first of two CodeJam's is on ABAP so Rich takes the lead showing how to use Joule with ABAP code and prompting the system to give contextual responses based on the functions you put into your ABAP code.  The group in Lima is loving it and the exercises fly by as they consume code they know but in a new way.  ABAP CodeJam Lima

 

quedada Lima

I won’t be able to stay for the second CodeJam due to my travel schedule, but that’s ok cause I am sure the Lima attendees are in good hands with Antonio and Rich.  I even heard that most of the GenAI content on day 2 was translated on the fly to español by Antonio. 

My favorite memory of the CodeJam and quedada was what I usually say about every event, the people.  Conversations about music, food, life.  The amount of time some attendees took to travel to be with us is staggering and so overwhelming.  Being present really does something for me that I am not sure the attendees of our community event’s realize. It’s not about what we discuss, what they learn, what product issue we may solve.  It’s the connection, the memories made together that are chapters in this amazing virtual novel I'm writing, event by event, called “My SAP Community journey”.  I hope you can all be present with us in some way and write your own stories.  Obrigado, gracias and thank you!

Oh, I almost forgot, Antonio made some world tour shirts!

Roadshow tour shirts by Antonio

 roadshow shirt close up

 

Now, for the second half of the LATAM roadshow I will hand over to my colleague @ajmaradiaga to let us know how things go in Mexico City and Bogota!

p.s. I am so sorry to all I can't post all the selfie pics and your name here, but maybe you can post the one's you took as a reply???

entry.title: Re: End-to-End Performance Testing of SAP BTP Cloud Foundry, Kyma and ABAP Environment based Applica
entry.content:
Hi Cocquerel,

Thanks for raising your query 🙂

Yes, Dynatrace can be bound with SAP CAP applications as well.

Please refer to this FAQ: https://pages.github.tools.sap/apm/faq

Query:

Can I enhance monitoring for my SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) Application?

Answer

Yes, SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) provides additional monitoring capabilities with Dynatrace. For example, you can track SAP HANA database calls of your Node.js applications. Perform performance troubleshooting and CPU/Memory time spend on CAP-Java and much more.

The use of Dynatrace is as well part of the Golden Path together with the rest of the BTP Observability services.

You find instructions on how to enable this feature as well on our documentation and on capire.

Remark:

  1. In short let say if you have mta.yaml configuration file than create a Dynatrace instance in BTP(Using Json file, directly through BTP User Interface) , define this newly created dynatrace instance inside mta.yaml file :

Ex:

  •               resources:

- name: XXX-dynatrace-dev

  type: org.cloudfoundry.existing-service

  •               Add the service in requires section of the Modules to be monitored.

requires:

  - name:

XXX-dynatrace-monitor

  1. Bind the Dynatrace service to BTP CF deployed application- cf bind-service
    (check if this is needed in your case since we are explicitly maintaining the newly created dynatrace instance name in mta.yaml file , most probably redeployment should work - cf deploy or via mbt build)

Remark: In case you are not able to see your binded CAP application service  in Dynatrace (even after redeploy/restart)

  • Sometimes a restart of the application is not enough, it needs to be a restage (only during staging the agent will be downloaded). Please restage your application and see if the process shows up after max 3 minutes(cf restage YOUR-APP)
  • Also try renaming your  Dynatrace service to something containing “dynatrace”, e.g.

Ex: Dynatrace instance creation using JSON file

cf create-service dynatrace environment test-dynatrace -c <json> file

and then bind the app/redeploy and restage again.

Reference : https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/devguide/deploy-apps/start-restart-restage.html

entry.title: Receipt of PT in another plant and its warehouse
entry.content:
Good day team,
Could you please help me by indicating what configuration I need?

The scenario is as follows:
I create an order for a customer at plant 5510, which doesn't manufacture, but I have another plant that does manufacture 55MY, and my manufacturing is against orders.

1.Therefore, since my manufacturing is made to order and my client is from plant 5510, I create an order for plant 5510.

2.In my planned order I notice that I can change to plant 55MY, which is where I manufacture the PT, but it doesn't let me select its corresponding warehouse 55LS. However, I leave it empty to see if I can indicate the warehouse in the entry.

3.My raw material is consumed at plant 55MY and warehouse 55LS and it is correct.

4.My time ticket is also correct and shows me as being at the 55MY plant.

5.The problem arises when I want to enter the PT and it won't let me change the plant 55MY, but the strange thing is that the warehouse 55LS has already arrived, obviously if I want to account for it it won't let me because it tells me that the warehouse doesn't belong with the plant.

Why won't it let me change the plant?

What do I need to configure so that I can change the plant and be able to account in warehouse 55SL?

😞

 

NOTE:

The curious thing is that in my master data I left the production storage location field empty in both plant 5510 and plant 55MY and as you can see the system in the PT receipt did add warehouse 55SL.

Why did it do that?

😞

entry.title: Re: Error: Failed to create ad-hoc schema export using ba...
entry.content:
Hi Team,

There is a file located at /var/log/SAPBusinessOne/Backupservice/logs/SID_SERVER_PORT: SCHEMA_NAME.pid. This file is editable. Open it and delete all the numbers, keeping only the largest one. After that, the export should run successfully.

I am using SAP 10 2411 Patch. I tried the same solution, but it didn’t work for me. So, I deleted the SCHEMA_NAME.pid file. After that, the export ran successfully.

regards.
Tinesh

entry.title: Post Asset Retirement as of OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with Universal Parallel Accounting (UPA)
entry.content:
Purpose

As of OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with UPA, the new Fiori app 'Post Asset Retirement'  has replaced two old, GUI-based apps:

  • Post Retirement (Non-Integrated) - Without Customer
  • Post Retirement - By Scrapping

This article describes the main features of the app, deep-diving into the details by comparing it with its predecessors. It also describes the customization of currency types in General Ledger Accounting (G/L), as well as analysis on some errors caused by impropper setups there.

Business Transaction Type

Similar to what you do in the Fiori app Post Asset Acquisition, you must enter company code, asset numbers, and a couple of mandatory fields for dates, i.e. Journal Entry Date, Posting Date, and Asset Value Date.

What's more important:  In the section 'Transaction Details', you must choose one 'Business Transaction Type' from the list, to tell the system: Do you want to retire the asset with or without any revenue?

⚠️Business Transaction Type has been introduced since the first Fiori app for asset posting was published, i.e. Post Asset Acquisition. As the successor, Business Transaction Type is much simpler than its predecessor, the traditional 3-digit-code of transaction type, which is not required as an input in any Fiori app for asset posting now.

Posting Parameters

The section 'Posting Data' is the place for you to enter the posting parameters. In the sub-section 'Valuation'', you can choose the ledgers and depreciation areas you that want to post to. ➡️ Once you choose a ledger, the system derives the depreciation areas from the ledger, and vice versa.

⚠️Hint: If you don't choose anything, neither ledger nor depreciation area, you'll post to all ledgers and all depreciation areas that are included in the current asset.

The 'Retirement Type' in the sub-section 'Retirement Details' is one of the most important fields of the app. The system gives you three options as following.

Partial Retirement

All these options are straightforward. However, if you compare retirement types above with those in its predecessor apps, you will find a bigg difference: you have only two options for your partial retirement, by amount or by percentage. 

In other words, the percentage of the partial retirement can only be decided by the amount or the percentage rate manually entered. ➡️ Even if the asset manages quantity, you cannot enter a quantity and ask the system to decide the percentage of the partial retirement from this quantity.

For example, in the current fiscal year, your assset has been capitalized with the amount 12,000 EUR and the quantity 10PC. With the posting parameters below, you will retire it by 50%, but only deduct the quantity by 3PC.

Obviously, in this example above, you only have acquisition postings in the current year. So you must choose 'Current Year'  in the field 'Year of Acquisition'. If you have prior-year acquisitions and you want to retire that part, you must choose 'Prior Year'.

⚠️ Only when you are going for a partial retirement, can you see these fields in the page: Retirement Amount, Quantity, & Year of Acquisition.

Retirement with Revenue

Once you choose the business transaction type 'Retirement with Revenue', some more fields will appear in the section 'Posting Data'.  

Like what you did in the predecessor apps, you can supply the revenue amount with the net book value (NBV) of a given depreciation area. By doing that, you will not generate any P&L effect.

Alternatively, you can manually enter the revenue amount yourself. 

 

⚠️ In this Fiori app, you cannot enter a revenue in any currency. Instead, you can only pick a currency type from the list via Currency Type of Revenue. This is different from the past. 

➡️ To avoid complex UI interaction, Currency Type of Revenue contains a full list of currency types supported by the company code. For example, the company code may support 3 currency types below, and all of them will appear in the list. ➡️  Check out the next chapter for more details about currency types.

  • 10 - Company Code Currency
  • 30 - Group Currency
  • 40 - Hard Currency

If the ledger 4G does not manage 40 (Hard Currency) but you only post your retirement to 4G, on hitting the button 'Display Line Items' or 'Simulate', you will get an error like below.

Customization of Currency Types

Currency Type is a complex setup in General Ledger Accounting (G/L). Asset Accounting is well integrated with G/L, especially with regard to currency types. So, it is worth giving some more words.

First, where can you find the currency types that are being managed by a ledger within a company code?

Run the t-code FINSC_LEDGER, choose a ledger from the node 'Ledger', navigate to the node 'Company Code Settings for the Ledger', and you will find this configuration.  ➡️ Here, in this example, the ledger BU in company code 1010 only supports two customerized currency types: ZU as the local currency type and ZV as the group currency type.

Next, how are those customized currency types related to the standard ones? 

Go to the node 'Currency Type', and check out the individual currency types. ➡️ Here, in this example, you can see that ZU and ZV are actually almost the same things as the standard currency types 10 and 30, but only with a different valuation view type: 3 (Segmentation Valuation). ➡️ In other words, ZU and ZV are just copies of currency types 10 and 30, but they are only designed for Segment Valuation.

Last but not least, which currency types are listed for the revenue amount in the Fiori app F7107?

In this example, the company code 1010 has many ledgers assigned, and with a lot of currency types, as shown in the database table FINSC_LD_CMP (below).

However, only 10, 30, 40 and Z0 are basic ones, a.k.a. 'Legal Currency Type' / 'Plain Currency Type', as shown in the database table FINSC_CURTYPE (below). All other currency types are just different valuations of those legal/plain currency types.

Therefore, the Fiori app only lists those legal/plain currency types for the revenue amount.

Errors about Currency Types

On hitting the button 'Simulate' or 'Post', you will get errors around currency types. Whenever you have this kind of error, most likely you have selected a wrong currency type of the revenue amount. 

One typical example is the error below. You can easily find the reason behind if you have another look at the table FINSC_LD_CMP (screenshot above): company code 1010 and ledger 4G has only defined currency types 11 and 31, whose plain/legal currency types are 10 and 30. And Z0 is not one of them.

Another example, in the screenshot below, the error KM132 states the currency type Z0 and valuation type 2 do not fit together. Then, please go back to check the table FINSC_CURTYPE (see the corresponding screenshot above) once again. ➡️ It is easy to see that no currency type has been defined as a copy of plain/legal currency type Z0 for valuation type 2 ('Profit Center Valuation'). 

Now, you want to retire the asset on BU and OD only. But you still get the error KM132. This time, it states the currency type Z0 and valuation type 3 do not fit together. 

Well, please go back to the database table FINSC_CURTYPE once more. This time the error is about valuation type 3, Segmentation Valuation. Then, the system looks up the table for the entries with 'VALUESUBTYP' (Subtype of Valuation View) BU for the plain/legal currency type Z0. There is no hit at all.

⚠️Corresponding configuration of VALUESUBTYP is inside the currency type settings below. And it is used ONLY for Segmentation Valuation.

Summary

You may have noticed it already that some posting parameters in this Fiori app used to be part of classic, 3-digit-code transaction types. But now, you can directly enter/choose them in the Fiori UI, without being confused by the 3-digit-codes.

Asset Accounting (AA) is well integrated with General Ledger (G/L). Some errors, especially those about ledgers or currency types, are reported from G/L but not AA. It is always helpful to check out the configrations in the t-code FINSC_LEDGER.

In OP2025 Private Cloud Edition with UPA, some other new Fiori apps are delivered as well. You may refer to the following SAP note to check out all those new apps as well as their tiles and busniess catalogs.

3614510 - Business Catalogs and Tiles for Asset Accounting with/without Universal Parallel Accounting in S/4HANA Private Cloud 2025 - SAP for Me

entry.title: Investment Boost: A significant step to promote economic growth
entry.content:
Co-Authors: @frank_afeaki and @olga_lazareva 

The New Zealand government has taken a significant step towards promoting economic growth with the launch of the "Investment Boost" initiative in Budget 2025.  This major tax incentive allows businesses to instantly deduct 20% of the cost of new assets, in addition to their regular depreciation. This substantial change is set to reduce tax liabilities and enhance cash flow, thereby empowering businesses to invest and grow.

While this news is undoubtedly welcome, it also presents the technical challenge of integrating this incentive into existing SAP Finance systems. Businesses must now adapt their asset accounting process to ensure they can fully leverage the benefits of the "Investment Boost" while maintaining compliance and operational efficiency. 

To take advantage of this tax benefit, our customers are required to post the 20% instant depreciation in addition to the regular depreciation. The key challenge here is to achieve the 20% immediate depreciation from the capitalization date while continuing regular depreciation.

For this special scenario, we chose to use the depreciation type 'special depreciation'. This type of depreciation allows for percentage depreciation and is commonly used for tax purposes. Using this depreciation type, in phase 1 we can apply a 20% special depreciation, which depreciates the asset by 20%. After this, phase 1 will continue with regular depreciation and depreciate based on the asset's useful life. However, the regular depreciation will now start with a net book value that is 20% less than the actual cost.

  • Phase 1: Special depreciation to post 20% of Investment Boost on the date of capitalization
  • Phase 1: Continue phase 1 with the regular depreciation, based on useful life, where reference value is Acquisition and Production Costs (APC) minus 20% special depreciation

To configure the keys, we need 2 different multi-level methods. The first multi-level method (IBS) is designed to cater to the 20% special depreciation, while the second method (IBR) is designed for regular depreciation.

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBS

Multilevel method for Special depreciation - IBR

Let's proceed to the configuration of the necessary depreciation keys. 

Sample Key for declining method:

Sample Key for straight line method:

We have tested the scenarios detailed below using the new investment boost depreciation keys, but we recommend that you perform your own testing to confirm that your results are as expected.

1. Investment boost posting with special depreciation key

The test was successful, with the 20% investment boost posted under special depreciation and the asset continued to depreciate based on useful life, with a reference value of APC minus 20% special depreciation. Example screenshot of the 20% investment boost posted with acquisition:

2. Subsequent additional acquisitions

The test was successful, result of test was the expected result. Example screenshot of additional acquisition:

3. Partial intra-company transfers and partial retirement

Unfortunately, this test was not successful, and the investment boost was doubled. Example screenshot of the partial intra-company transfer:

To overcome the issues with the partial transfers and partial retirement, we had to design a new depreciation key, in this example NIMD which allowed for no additional special depreciation posting during transfers and retirement. To achieve this, we propose a workaround based on time intervals which would fix these inconsistencies. 

Key points to remember here are:

  • The depreciation key NIMD is designed with a special depreciation phase with base method 23 which allows for no additional special depreciation during partial transfers and retirement.
  • Needs to be assigned to both the sender and the receiver asset.
  • Works from the beginning of the period and does not provide scope for changes in between the period.

Sample depreciation key for partial transfers and retirement:

Screenshot of changing the asset depreciation key to the NIMD depreciation key using time intervals on the asset as well as the successful partial intra-company transfers.

Sending asset - intra-company transfer:

Receiver Asset - intra-company transfer: 

4.  Subsequent qualifying investment boost acquisition against existing assets:

This scenario is relevant for assets that were acquired before the investment boost period.  Here, you cannot change to the investment boost depreciation key using time interval as you will more likely get the error message "AA591: Depreciation key has more depreciation types than the previous deprec. key".

See the screenshot below using the Investment boost straight line depreciation key NIBS

As a workaround, we propose you create an asset sub-number of the original asset using the investment boost depreciation key and book the acquisition against the new asset sub number.

Conclusion

In summary, the implementation of the new investment boost scheme offers a powerful opportunity for businesses to benefit from significant tax incentives and enhanced cash flow. However, maximizing these advantages will require the configuration of new multi-level depreciation keys to incorporate the investment boost requirements.  Creating and using the new multi-level investment boost depreciation keys will meet the main requirements, but a work around is required to handle scenarios such as a partial intra-company and partial retirements, as described above. By configuring the workaround described above, which involves a time interval adjustment on the asset, organizations can ensure accurate compliance and optimize their use of the investment boost. Diligent testing and thoughtful setup are essential for successfully navigating these complexities and securing the full benefit of this government initiative.

entry.title: Re: Regarding tab control in MIRO (ECC)
entry.content:
Why the material tab never appears for Your “Normal” MIRO posting is because, even though you’ve ticked both “Direct posting to G/L accounts” and “Direct posting to material accounts” in IMG, SAP only shows the Material (and G/L) tabs in MIRO when you execute a subsequent‐debit or subsequent‐credit posting; not for the standard PO‐based invoice.

To see the material tab in MIRO, enter your Vendor and PO as usual. On the header toolbar, click the dropdown arrow next to Invoice and choose Subsequent Debit (or Credit). The screen will refresh—and you’ll now see a Material tab alongside the G/L Account tab. That tab is your manual-posting cockpit where you can enter quantities, valuation types, and post directly to the inventory account.

Why the standard invoices don’t show it is because, SAP assumes your PO‐invoice (MIRO with indicator “Invoice”) simply offsets GR/IR. The stock valuation is automatically adjusted via OBYC settings. Exposing the Material tab for a normal invoice would let users accidentally bypass GR/IR and break your reconciliation logic.

entry.title: Re: Unable to see the log during Invoice cancellation
entry.content:
Some of the root causes are your custom logic under SD_BIL_FLEX_CANCELLATION fires in the debugger but produces a blank log screen at runtime. This almost always means one (or more) of these issues:

  • Your BAdI implementation isn’t actually called in the upgraded Quality system
  • You’re not persisting application-log entries, so VF11 has nothing to display
  • You’re running VF11 via a new Fiori/OData app that uses a different BAdI spot

Even if the code is transported, it may not be active or assigned in Quality. In SE18, open enhancement spot SD_BIL_FLEX_CANCELLATION. Check Implementations and ensure your custom one is Active. If you have multiple implementations, confirm the one with your IRN-check logic is highest priority. If this step fails, VF11 never invokes your code—so no log entries will ever be created.

If your Quality system is on S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition), the classic VF11 GUI transaction may be replaced by a Fiori app or OData service that doesn’t call SD_BIL_FLEX_CANCELLATION. Instead, it uses a new BAdI, for example CANCELLATION_S4_FP or CANCELLATION_S4H_DPP.

entry.title: Re: How to calculate depreciation for multiple capitaliza...
entry.content:
Hi @nasser_itani 

Please refer to the following Advanced Formulas script and SAC model to get your expectation.

  • Dimension: DIM_WBS_PROJECT

  • Advanced Formulas script
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "Amount"
MEMBERSET [d/Account] = ("CAPEX_002","CAPEX_004", "CAPEX_005", "CAPEX_006", "CAPEX_007")
MEMBERSET [d/CostCenter] = "#"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_BUDGETYEAR] = "2026"
MEMBERSET [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT] = ("1-1011003", "1-1011004", "1-1011005", "1-1011006")
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = "2023" TO "2060"

VARIABLEMEMBER #Depreciable_Amt OF [d/Account]

INTEGER @USEFULLIFE
INTEGER @Count
INTEGER @Move

FOREACH.BOOKED [d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT]
	@USEFULLIFE = ATTRIBUTE([d/DIM_WBS_PROJECT].[p/USEFUL_LIFE])

	FOREACH [d/Date]
		//Aggregate the capitalized amount to calculate the source value for depreciation and write it to the variable member.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002") != Null THEN
			@Move = 0
			FOR @Count = 1 TO @USEFULLIFE
				DATA.APPEND([d/Account] = #Depreciable_Amt, [d/Date] = NEXT(@Move)) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
				@Move = @Move + 1
			ENDFOR
		ENDIF

		//Calculate the depreciation amount.
		DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004", [d/Date] = NEXT(1)) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = #Depreciable_Amt) / @USEFULLIFE

		//Copy the capitalization value to calculate the fixed assets.
		DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")

		//Filter the periods where depreciation value exists.
		IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004") != Null THEN
			
			//To calculate the accumulated depreciation, aggregate the previous month's accumulated depreciation and the current month's depreciation value.
			DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_004")
			
			//To calculate the fixed assets, aggregate the previous month's fixed assets value and the current month's capitalized value.
			DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) + RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_002")
			
			//To calculate the net book value, subtract the accumulated depreciation value from the fixed assets value.
			DATA([d/Account] = "CAPEX_006") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_007", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) - RESULTLOOKUP([d/Account] = "CAPEX_005")
		ENDIF

	ENDFOR
ENDFOR
  • Source Data

  • Calculated Result

I hope this is helpful to you, and if I have misunderstood anything, please feel free to reach out.

Regards,

Moonjun

entry.title: Re: Business Partner Catalog Numbers - DTW error 65171
entry.content:
That 65171 error is DTW telling you it can’t locate the OSCN record using the keys you supplied (Business Partner + Item). In practice this means one of a few things is off in your template or environment. DTW looks up the record by the combination of BP code and ItemCode. If it doesn’t find an existing line for that pair, it throws 65171 and stops.

entry.title: Integrate Resource Management with SAP Cloud ALM
entry.content:
SAP Cloud ALM is a cloud-based application lifecycle management solution that helps you streamline the implementation and operation of your cloud and hybrid business solutions.

As mentioned in our blog post, “Setup Resource Management Capability in SAP Projects and Resource Management,” we recommend that our customers integrate Resource Management (RM) with SAP Cloud ALM. This integration allows you to monitor the status of master data and transactional data replication between Resource Management and source systems like SAP Master Data Integration, SAP S/4HANA Cloud, and SAP SuccessFactors.

Consequently, we have published the current blog to offer a clear introduction to the exact steps required for prerequisites and configuration for CALM integration, as well as guidance on how to monitor data replication for RM.

Prerequisites to setup the RM monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM

To set up the monitoring, you must have a subscription to SAP Cloud ALM. For more information regarding setup, see details. This section details the crucial steps to ensure a smooth setup for SAP Cloud ALM.

    1. Requesting SAP Cloud ALM on SAP for Me
      You can request SAP Cloud ALM on SAP for Me for yourself or for all entitled customers for whom you have sufficient permissions:
      - You have an S-user with the role Edit Cloud Data on SAP for Me.
      - You're assigned to the customer number.

      Steps:
      1.1 Open the Systems & Provisioning dashboard on SAP for Me.
      1.2 Under Systems to be Provisioned, find your entitlement for SAP Cloud ALM.

      1.3 Choose Start Provisioning.
      1.4 In the dialog, provide the following information:
      Region:

      • Specify the geographical region in which you would like to have SAP Cloud ALM provisioned. This region corresponds to the location of the data center where your SAP Cloud ALM tenant will be deployed.
      • After the system has been provisioned, the region can't be changed.

      Subdomain:

      • Enter a unique subdomain name. The subdomain name is used for the creation of an SAP Cloud ALM-specific subaccount on SAP BTP. It's also part of the URL that is used to access SAP Cloud ALM.
      • We strongly recommend using the suffix -cloudalm at the end of the subdomain name, for example, company-cloudalm.
      • After the tenant has been provisioned, the subdomain can't be changed.

      SAP Cloud Identity Services:

      • If you don’t have an existing productive Identity Authentication tenant, a new one will be created for you in the region you've selected above.
      • If you already have a productive Identity Authentication tenant, select it from the list.

      Main IT Contact:

      • As the requesting user, you're assigned as the Main IT Contact for SAP Cloud ALM by default.
      • After the provisioning, the selected Main IT Contact receives the SAP Cloud ALM welcome email and all authorizations that are required for the initial setup and for further administrative tasks.
      1.5 If you agree to the terms and conditions stated in the linked order document, mark the checkbox.
      1.6 Choose Submit.

      Note: Refer to the following help document for more details:
      https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/setup-administration/provisioning?locale=en-US

    2. Onboard Users in the Identity Authentication Service

      To give further users access to SAP Cloud ALM, you need to create or import users in your Identity Authentication tenant. For users to be able to sign in to SAP Cloud ALM, they need to be maintained both in the Identity Authentication tenant and in SAP Cloud ALM.
      This blog is dedicated to the user creation process for a new identity authentication tenant. If you have reused an existing identity authentication tenant, please consult the help documentation for guidance.
      The Prerequisites to add a user are:

      - Your Identity Authentication tenant has been activated.
      - In your Identity Authentication tenant, you have a user with the role Manage Users.

      Steps:
      2.1 In the administration console of the SAP Cloud Identity Services, open the User Management app.
      2.2 Choose + Add User.
      2.3 Fill in the required fields.
      Note: Remember the email address, as you need it to assign roles to the user later.
      2.4 Under Personal Information, enter the first and last name of the user. Use only the allowed characters A-Z, a-z, spaces, and hyphens.
      2.5 Save.
      2.6 Select Send activation e-mail.
      2.7 Save your entries.
      Note: Refer to the following help document for more details:
      https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/setup-administration/user-onboarding?locale=en-US

    3. Assign Roles to Users in SAP Cloud ALM

      After onboarding your users to your Identity Authentication tenant, you need to add them to SAP Cloud ALM and assign roles to them.

      You can add users and assign roles to them directly in the SAP Cloud ALM User Management app (recommended) or as corresponding role collections in the SAP BTP cockpit.

      In this blog, we specifically focus on introducing it in SAP Cloud ALM User Management. If you need to perform actions in the SAP BTP cockpit, please refer to the help document for guidance.

      Steps:
      3.1 Access SAP Cloud ALM. A link is included in the email Welcome to SAP Cloud ALM.
      Sign in with the email address and password you've defined when activating your account in the Identity Authentication service. Don't sign in with your S-user.
      3.2 Open the User Management app, which is located on the Administration page.
      3.3 To go to the user list, choose icon (Users).
      3.4 Choose Add User.
      3.5 Enter the User ID and/or Email as you've defined them in the settings of your identity provider. If you've selected your email address as your user ID in your identity provider, you only need to enter the email address.
      3.6 Select a type for your user. Possible types are:

      Type

      Description

      Not Assigned

      No user type (default value)

      Employee

      Employee of your company

      SAP

      Consultant from SAP

      Partner

      Consultant from official SAP partner

      Other

      Person from a company other than SAP or official SAP partner

      3.7 Assign one or multiple roles to the user.
      For an overview of all predefined role collections that are available in SAP Cloud ALM, refer to Role Collections.
      3.8 Save your settings.

      Note: Please refer to the following help document “SAP Cloud ALM User Management” for more details. If you prefer to assign roles to users in SAP BTP Cockpit, navigate to section “SAP BTP Cockpit”.
      https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-alm/setup-administration/role-assignment?locale=en-US

    4. Set Up Landscape Management
      Check in the Landscape Management app of SAP Cloud ALM to make sure that the resource management service is listed here. Your resource management service should be automatically imported if they are assigned to the same customer number as your SAP Cloud ALM tenant. If the service is not listed here, perform manually import. If the service still doesn't appear, create a ticket in the component SV-CLM-INF-LMS.

      Steps:
      4.1 Go to Landscape Management app.
      4.2 Open the Select a Scope , search and select 'SAP Project and Resource Management, resource management capability' in the filter filed Service Type, click Go.

      4.3 In the results list, you will be able to see whether your Resource Management (RM) has been imported automatically. Below is a sample for reference.

      4.4 If the service is not listed here, goto the Landscape Management app, open the Configuration, expand the section Import of Subscribed SAP Services, and click on the first icon after Status of imports.

      4.5 Start an import on demand by choosing Import My Subscribed SAP Services.


      4.6 After import manually, repeat steps 2-3. If the SPRM service is still not listed there, create a ticket in the component SV-CLM-INF-LMS and provide information about your tenant and the actions you have performed.

Configure RM monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM

To configure Integration & Exception Monitoring for RM, make sure you have:

  • The Integration Architect role
  • RM is connected in the Landscape Management app as previously described.

Follow the instructions provided below to Activate the Monitoring Data Collection. For more detailed information, refer to page SAP Project and Resource Management, resource management capability. Other sections such as Customize the Monitoring Data Collection, Create Monitoring Events are optional.
Steps:

  1. Open the Integration & Exception Monitoring app under Operations tab.
  2. Open the scope selection via the bulls-eye icon in the upper right corner.
  3. Change the drop-down for "Managed Components" to 'Services', and "Service Type" to 'SAP Project and Resource Management, resource management capability'.
  4. Select the RM service you want to set up in the scope.
  5. Click "Apply".
  6. Click the rack-wheel icon in the upper right corner to access the configuration.
  7. Expand the "Configuration" tray, navigate to the 'Services/Systems' section, and locate the RM service you selected in Step 4.
  8. Change the toggle button next to the RM service you want to set up from OFF to ON. Then navigate into the RM service to configure the RM specific monitoring.
  9. Change the toggle button under Data Collection from OFF to ON.
  10.  Change the toggle button under Active from OFF to ON to activate the transactional data and master data monitoring.

Monitoring data replication for RM

After configuring the integration with SAP Cloud ALM, you can monitor the messages for the business service RM in the Integration & Exception Monitoring application of SAP Cloud ALM. This encompasses the master data replication monitoring and transactional data replication monitoring.

  1. Master Data Replication

    Master data replication happens between resource management and SAP Master Data Integration, along with source systems such as SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP SuccessFactors. You can monitor the following master data replications:

    - Cost center
    - Service Organization
    - Workforce person
    - Workforce capability

    Steps:

    1. Open the Integration & Exception Monitoring app under Operations tab.
    2. You can directly view and open the ‘Messages’ for RM service under the Overview tab.
    3. Navigate into the Master Data Messages.
    4. You can review messages by status, direction, service role, or communication scenario. To access details for a specific message, click the arrow on the right side.
    5. Or if you have the master data details, you can track related messages by clicking the Tracking tab directly. Enter the master data, such as workforce personal ID or service organization ID, and then click Go.
    6. You will see the error messages related to the master data you entered. You can review the error details by navigating into the specific messages.

      Note: Refer to the following help document for more details:
      https://help.sap.com/docs/PPRM_OD/542f4545bc9d4ecd80bc3a0a6913a735/872bca2ead724e16a9d9518c7186fb4e.html?locale=en-US&version=LATEST

  2. Project Data Replication
    Project data replication happens between resource management and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Project data includes transactional information such as project details and the details of the associated work packages and demands.

    Steps:

    1. Open the Integration & Exception Monitoring app under Operations tab.
    2. You can directly view and open the 'Messages' for RM service under the Overview tab.
    3. Navigate into the Transactional Messages.
    4. You can review messages by status, direction, or object types. To access details for a specific message, click the arrow on the right side.
    5. Or if you have the project data details, you can track related messages by clicking the Tracking tab directly. Enter the project data, such as project ID or demand ID, and then click Go.
    6. You will see the error messages related to the project data you entered. You can review the error details by navigating into the specific messages.

entry.title: Re: Purchase order, credit memo and consumed amount
entry.content:
When you post a credit memo against a purchase order in Funds Management, SAP doesn’t simply “cancel” the original invoice consumption. It runs through its budget-update routines and applies the reversal using the commitment item you’ve entered on the credit memo. That in turn recalculates the PO’s overall consumed amount. Here’s how it works:

Budget Consumption Flow for a PO + Invoice
During PO creation, Commitment (value type 10) reduces your available commitment budget for the PO’s Funds Center/Commitment Item.
During Goods receipt, Commitment remains, but you may activate actuals on GR (value type 20) if configured.
During Invoice receipt, System converts the PO commitment into an actual posting (value type 50) and consumes payment budget (value type 54). At any point, the “Consumed Amount” shown on the PO equals the sum of all these FM value types for that PO line.

When you create a credit memo (MIRO/F-43 reversal) against the PO, SAP assigns it BCT 120 (credit memo). Under that BCT, the system reverses the actuals and payment consumption previously posted. Crucially, it uses the account assignment (Funds Center + Commitment Item) you enter on the credit memo.

Why your consumed amount changes is because, your credit memo carries a different Commitment Item, FM performs the negative posting against that new CI. The result is the original CI’s actual consumption is not fully reversed there (so its net consumed figure shifts). The new CI picks up the negative posting, skewing the overall PO-line budget values. SAP recalculates the PO’s “Consumed Amount” as the algebraic sum of all FM value types on that line—hence you see a change.

To keep your PO’s consumed amount stable—even when you need to credit—choose one of these approaches:

  • Align Credit CI with PO CI Always use the same Commitment Item on your credit memo as was on the original invoice.
  • Override CI Derivation via FMDERIVE In IMG → Funds Management → Derivation → FMDERIVE, add a rule for BCT 120 that forces the CI to the PO’s CI.
  • Exclude Credit Memos from Budget Updates In FM update profile (FMPA/FMPU01), set the “Credit Memo” indicator to Do Not Update for actuals.
  • Post Returns Separately Instead of MIRO reversal, post a return delivery (MB1A with return movement) so that only the GR commitment reverses—leaving invoice-based actuals untouched.

entry.title: Can't find archived documents in external repository with Business Object data
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we are currently developing a CMIS service that is able to talk to different document management systems like d.velop documents or SharePoint Online.
Our customers want to be able to archive documents from SAP within DMS like these but we have a crucial problem with SAP:
When SAP archives any documents within external repositories, it does not give any information about the Business Object the document was created from.

For example: A customer attaches a document to some purchase order. SAP will only archive the document as cmis:document with an ArchiveDocumentId.
You can query Purchase Order Attachments via the API and will find this ID.
But you are unable to search for the ID to find out the document came from a purchase order and get the purchase order's data.

See, DMS are made to find documents by attributes.
If an attachment of a purchase order is archived, you will want to be able to find this attachment in the DMS by, for example, searching for the order number.
But there is not way to get this data.

So we would like SAP to also send the Business Object entity name and the primary key along with the documents.
This way, you could look up the Business Object entity and filter for the primary key to get the rest of the data and write it to the document in the DMS.

We are eager to see if there is other people/companies having interest in this because currently external repositories are more like a big pool of documents only SAP can find documents in.

Best regards
Timo Brückmann

entry.title: AI-assisted resolution of detected exceptions (Solving Tips) in Cloud ALM
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog we would discuss recently made available Artificial Intelligence use cases - AI-assisted resolution of detected exceptions (Solving Tips) in Cloud ALM. This feature is available in Integration and Exception monitoring for exceptions raised for a supported solution.

To Understand more about Integration and Exception Monitoring(IEM) please refer to

https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/integration-monitoring.html 

Cloud ALM Expert Portal for operations is a one stop solution for all your Operations related asks in Cloud ALM. https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal.html

  1. AI-assisted resolution of detected exceptions (Solving Tips) in Cloud ALM

Cloud ALM’s Exception Monitoring(EM) provides an artificial intelligence assisted feature to provide problem solving tips for the raised exception.

This AI  feature is available for the all the users by default without any additional configurations.  Using it customers can easily see the SAP recommended notes for the exception and have the option to directly navigate to SAP for Me to read the complete possible solution by a single click, thus reducing time and effort to resolve the problem.

 

  1.  To access Problem solving tips follow the steps mentioned below.

Go to Integration and Exception monitoring in Operations area.

 

2.2 Select the required system to view the raised exceptions. Selected system would be available in the screen as highlighted below. 2.3Click on the Exceptions link, in this can it is for MyS4HANA_S4D system. Number of exceptions per category would be listed per category.

2.4 Select a category like (ABAP Application Log). All the exceptions raised are listed here.

2.5 Click on an exception. Details about the exception are listed here.

2.6 Solving tips are recommended for this particular exception in the Solving Tips Tab.

2.7 You can click on the recommended note to navigate to SAP for Me to read the note.

Additional Information.

You get the option to fine tune the result by providing additional keywords.

entry.title: Re: Receipt of PT in another plant and its warehouse
entry.content:
In SAP PP the Plant on a production order is a non‐editable header field. It’s derived from the planned order or procurement‐type settings and locked once the order is created. Likewise, the Warehouse (in an EWM or WM context) is tied to that plant + storage‐location combination via customizing. Below is how to handle your make-to-order scenario so the system auto-fires production in Plant 55MY and posts the GR to Warehouse 55SL—all without manual header changes.

When you convert a planned order (or create a production order directly), SAP copies the Plant from the planning element. • That Plant field becomes part of the order key and cannot be changed in transactions like CO01/CO02 or during confirmations. • Any goods movements (CO11, MIGO, or staging/de‐staging in EWM) will always use that order’s plant.

Why you saw 5510 stuck on the PO/production order: You created the order for Plant 5510 (your sales/make-to-order plant), so that same plant carried through to the PO and the production order.

To answer your question of how to auto-plan Production in Plant 55MY is instead of creating the order at 5510 and then trying to change it, configure SAP to plan directly in the manufacturing plant:

  • Maintain Special Procurement on the finished material at Plant 5510 – MRP 2 tab (Transaction MM02 → select Plant 5510 → MRP2) – Set Special Procurement Key = 50 (In-House Production) – Enter Procurement Plant = 55MY – (Also fill GR Processing Time and Production Storage Location here for lead-time and warehouse defaults.)
  • Run MRP (MD02/MD03 or Fiori Schedule MRP Runs) for Plant 5510 – SAP will generate a planned order in Plant 55MY, not in 5510.
  • Convert the Planned Order in 55MY to a Production Order (CO40/CO02) – The new production order’s header Plant = 55MY – You can now post material issue and GR all within 55MY.

Once the order truly belongs to Plant 55MY, you must link its storage‐location to your warehouse number fill Production Storage Location in the Material Master (MM02 → Plant 55MY → MRP2) – Enter your storage location code (e.g., LS04 if that’s the one you pick). Assign Warehouse Number to Plant + Storage Location – SPRO → Logistics Execution → Extended Warehouse Management → Master Data → Assign Warehouse Number to Plant and Storage Location – Add an entry: Plant 55MY + Storage Location (as in step 1) → Warehouse 55SL. With this in place, when you post the goods receipt in CO11 or MIGO, the system will default your EWM warehouse to 55SL and allow you to post without “warehouse-plant mismatch” errors.

Why you saw 55SL even with blank Production-Storage Location is because, if Production Storage Location is blank, SAP falls back to the storage‐location determination logic in OM (“Goods Receipt Storage Location” in IMG), picking the first configured storage location for Plant 55MY. If that storage-location is already assigned to Warehouse 55SL in EWM, the warehouse number pops in—even though your material master field was empty. This is why 55SL showed up on your first try, but it then rejected posting once you tried to override the plant.

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update – Part 3: Beta AI Innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
This third post in my series gives an overview of the very latest user experience innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, which are so new that they are only released for customers to try them out via beta testing. They are all AI-related, for My Home, for working with SAP Fiori elements based applications, as well as for some individual application use cases.

In case you missed them, Part 2 covers the generally available UX innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and Part 1 explains how users in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition can query SAP Analytics Cloud directly via Joule, as well as providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services.

This post covers these innovations for:

My Home

  • AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home.
  • AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications.

SAP Fiori elements based applications

  • AI-assisted easy fill.
  • AI-assisted error explanation.

Individual application uses cases

  • AI-assisted payment exception analysis.
  • Accounting accruals agent.

If you want to try out these features as beta testers, then sign-up for beta testing here:

  • Q3/25: Latest AI-assisted user experience features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508

Find out more about beta programs and how to Get Involved Early with SAP innovations in general.

 

My Home UX Innovations

AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home

With this feature, you can now get details of a Business Situation shown directly in place on My Home, and even initiate quick actions or make changes to business data there. This is achieved by expanding the Situation card on My Home when you click on it, as you can see in Figure 1, or in action in this video:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:00 min.)

Figure 1: Beta: AI-Assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home. Alt Text: An image with two screenshots: the upper one shows the top part of My Home showing three Situation cards in the To-Dos section. One titled “This sales quotation is about to expire” is highlighted and linked with an arrow to an expanded card shown in the second screenshot – the card is taller and wider, contains a summary on the left with three action buttons “Change Validity”, “Reject All Items”, “Close Situation”, and more details on the right.

AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications

So far, as I outlined in Part 2, you can use natural language and AI to personalize your My Home by adding Insights Cards. Now, with this beta functionality, you can use natural language to find and add applications and insights tiles.

If you have the functionality activated in your system, you’ll see the AI button “Add Content” in the salutation bar at the top of My Home, as shown at the top of Figure 2. Clicking on this brings a pop-over with the option to add Insights Cards or, as shown, Apps & Insights Tiles. By describing what you want to do, the system will propose suitable applications and Insights Tiles. If you select them and click “Add”, they will be added, either as an entry in your Apps Favorites section, or in the Insights Tiles section. Figure 2 shows these main steps.

Figure 2: Beta: AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications. Alt Text: The image shows three screenshots: at the top an extract of My Home showing the blue salutation bar, with an AI button “Add Content” on the right. An arrow has been added linking it to the second screenshot, where a popover “Add Content” is shown, where the user has entered “I want to monitor sales orders what app should I use to do this”, and two of four results are listed and visualized: “Track Sales Orders” and “Manage Sales Orders” (shown as an insight tile). Below that a screenshot of the outcome in My Home: the former is added to Apps Favorites, the latter to Insights Tiles.

 Watch a demo:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Smart Personalization of My Home for Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:11 min.)

 For a summary of all the news for My Home, both generally available and for beta-testing, read this blog post:

  • My Home in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 - What's new?

 

AI UX Innovations for Applications based on SAP Fiori elements

AI-Assisted Easy Fill

Users often receive requests via e-mails or chats to change data in the system. This new feature makes it much easier to update the fields in the various sections of an object page based on SAP Fiori elements, such as a sales order. Instead of manually scanning the e-mail and navigating to the relevant sections and fields in the object page, you can just paste the text into Easy Fill and it will automatically identify the correct fields to update, with proposals for the correct entries.

The power of AI means that the new values do not have to be exactly contained in the text. Figure 3 shows an example, where the new address is given without actually mentioning the name of the city, only the street and post code, along with an abbreviation for the state and country (“BW DE”). As you can see, the proposed new values are correct, despite this missing or abbreviated information.

Figure 3: Beta: AI-Assisted Easy Fill for SAP Fiori elements based applications. Alt-Text: A screenshot showing an Easy Fill pop-over, with a text entry field on the left with text from a customer e-mail informing about a change of name and address for their store, and on the left showing the “Filled Fields”, a list of seven fields for which new values are proposed.

Watch a demo:

  • Video: AI-Assisted Easy Fill of SAP Fiori Elements-Based Applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (1:15 min.)

Note that this feature is only available for applications based on SAP Fiori elements.

AI-Assisted Error Explanation

We started beta testing for this with the 2502 release, and have decided to continue with beta testing in this 2508 release. The explanation I gave in my February blog post continues to apply:

New users who are unfamiliar with the system may find that the short error messages give too little information for them to fully understand the issue, and what to do about it. The AI-Assisted Error Explanation (beta) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition summarizes information which explains the error and provide a recommendation for how to resolve it. Figure 8 shows an example where a user has entered a Sold-to-Party ID which does not exist in the system.

Note that this feature is also only available for applications based on SAP Fiori elements.

Figure 4: Beta: AI-Assisted Error Explanation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502. ALT Text: On the left part of a data entry screen is shown, with the field “Sold-to Party containing “ABC” marked red and below that a  popover with an error message “No customer master record exists for sold-to-party ABC”, and in the text line below that the AI icon followed by “Generate Explanation”. A fat arrow leads from this text to the image on the right, which indicates what happens when you click on this text: you get a popover with an short Explanation section and a longer Resolution section with numbered actions.

If you want a summary of the latest such generic AI-assisted features, both generally available and for beta-testing, with some different examples, have a look at this blog post:

  • Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508.

 

AI Innovations in Individual Application Use Cases

AI-Assisted Payment Exception Analysis

Most payments of invoices from vendors are automated, but sometimes data is missing or incorrect so that an automatic payment fails. These issues are collected in error logs, and one of the more tedious tasks of Accounts Payable Accountant is to scan through these error logs, understand what went wrong and why, and then fix it.

With AI-assisted payment exception analysis, we make this task much easier and less tedious: users can choose an entry in the error log and simply click on the AI button “Analyze Exception”. The system then provide an analysis, a recommended resolution in natural language, as well as a links to a selection of the most relevant log entries. If a user wants all the relevant logs, they are just one click away. Figure 5 shows what this looks like:

Figure 5: Beta: AI-assisted payment exception analysis. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Revise Payment Proposals applicatin, showing a list of payment exceptions grouped by Error ID. Four error IDs are listed, covering 419 exceptions. One is expanded and has one exception listed in the row below. The main part of the image is a pop-over “Exception Analysis and Resolution”, with natural language explanations in sections “Analysis” and “Resolution” and a section “Logs” with a list of selected logs, and a button to select “All Logs”.

Alternatively, watch this:

  • Video: AI-assisted payment exception analysis (1:20 min.)

Accounting Accruals Agent

An accrual is an accounting entry which represents revenue which has been earned or expenses which have incurred but for which no payment has yet been made. That way, when looking at a particular period such as a quarter or a month, accountants get a more accurate picture of a company’s financial position. For example, if a service was delivered, but not paid for within the period, having the accrual means that the cost of delivering the service and the revenue associated with it both appear in the summary for the period.

Calculating accruals and deferrals is often time very time consuming. It can also require estimates based on historical data, if for example invoices have not yet been created, or payment amounts can be reduced if payments are made quickly in the future.

The new accounting accruals agent can significantly speed this up, potentially reducing the time spent on these activities by 80%! This frees up accountants to work on more value-adding activities, such as analysis. As you can see in Figure 6, the agent creates a list of accrual proposals. For each proposal, you can details on the recommendation, including an explanation for the basis of the recommendation.

Figure 6: Beta: Accrual Proposals made by the accounting accruals agent. Alt Text: A screenshot of the Accrual Proposals applications, showing a list of six accrual proposals on the left. The details of the one selected are shown on the right, showing the recommended accrual amount, the proposed line items and a section “Basis of AI Recommendation” with a natural language explanation along with a bar chart and a forecast line for the trend per month.

Watch this video to find out more:

  • Video: Accounting Accruals Agent (1:36 min.)

 

Continued soon …

I hope you enjoyed this third part, covering the new UX innovations available for beta testing with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. I will post part four in the next few days, covering exciting new UX innovations available SAP Success Factors.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Re: Why still the selection id is there in COR4/OPL8
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA the production version is mandatory because it unifies BOM and routing determination for MRP runs, production order creation, and PP/DS sourcing. This eliminates the old MARC-ALTSL method and simplifies master data by making the production version the only control point for alternative BOMs and routings.

Although the production version governs BOM/routing choice, SAP kept the Selection ID and BOM Application fields in transactions OPL8 and COR4 for these reasons:

Backward compatibility
Avoids disruption of legacy custom code, user exits, and interfaces that reference those fields

Transitional and niche scenarios

  • Supports data migrations or initial project phases before all production versions exist
  • Allows variant‐configuration or manual‐override use cases where standard PV logic may not suffice

Override capabilities
Even with PV mandatory, Selection ID settings let you fine-tune which version the system picks per plant and order type.

SAP marks these fields as deprecated for greenfield implementations and recommends relying solely on production versions for BOM and routing selection.

Below are the some of the Best‐Practice Recommendations

  • Maintain production versions for every manufactured material in each plant.
  • Use OPL8 only to adjust production‐version selection behavior in exceptional cases.
  • Phase out any custom logic or dependencies on Selection ID and BOM Application to align with the simplified S/4HANA data model.

By focusing on production versions, you ensure consistent, transparent, and supportable PP/DS and MRP processes in your S/4HANA system.

entry.title: Re: The estimate cost field USER4 in AUFK or CAUFV table...
entry.content:
Hello,

Key Considerations:
AUFK-USER4 is a customer-specific field often added via enhancement (CI_AUFK).Changes to AUFK fields must be explicitly updated using proper SAP function modules or BAPIs, otherwise they won't reflect in the database even if they appear in the UI temporarily.The release status of the order does not inherently block updates to USER4, but updating order master data incorrectly can lead to issues due to buffering, commits, or missing UPDATE logic.       marykayintouch com

entry.title: Re: Guidance Required: Loading Freight and GST on Freight...
entry.content:
Apart from the SAP note already suggested, some of the key considerations are

  • Even with Note 2505928 in place, you must maintain separate account keys for freight and GST in OBYC. Otherwise, the default OPS postings won’t include these costs in inventory.
  • Your STO billing‐type must have its own pricing procedure. SAP does not supply a reference pricing procedure for GST invoices—design one to include PR00 (base price), ZFR1 (freight), ZFRE (GST on freight), etc.
  • Test both intrastate (CGST+SGST) and interstate (IGST) scenarios. Ensure your vendor and customer masters have correct GSTINs in the Tax Number 3 field to trigger the right tax codes.
  • If you split freight by multiple deliveries or weight/value scales, use the “Scale Basis” in M/06 on ZFR1.

entry.title: Re: Batch Determination
entry.content:
Try with the below approach

Create a characteristic for color in Transaction CT04 → Characteristic ID ZCOLOR. Define a Batch‐Class that uses ZCOLOR, Transaction CL02 → Class “BATCH_COLOR”. Assign characteristic ZCOLOR. Attach this class to each batch of your components (B & C). Use MSC1N/MSC2N to assign ZCOLOR = White, Red, Blue… on every B/C batch.

In SPRO navigate to Logistics General → Batch Management → Batch Determination and Batch Check → Batch Search Procedure Definition. Create a new procedure, e.g. SUBC,  Add Selection criterion = ZCOLOR. In the same IMG branch, go to Batch Search Procedure Allocation, Assign procedure SUBC to movement type 543 (consumption of subcontracting components).

Next you have to define an Object Dependency to “Copy” A’s Color. For that go to SPRO → Batch Management → Batch Determination and Batch Check → Batch Determination with Object Dependencies. Create a new entry: – Dependency Type = Procedure – Selection Class = your class “BATCH_COLOR” – Influencing Characteristic = ZCOLOR – Batch Class = the same “BATCH_COLOR” – Procedure ID = SUBC.
What this does is at runtime, when SAP calls batch determination for the 543 posting, it will pull ZCOLOR from the preceding document’s batch (that’s your subcontracted‐A GR), and feed it as the search value into the SUBC procedure.

entry.title: Check Field and Value Check foreign key table (dependent table)
entry.content:
I want to validate a row of data when uploading excel data to ALV. But I need to validate the data of the table ZTEST1111 below which contains DOCMT as the primary key and is checked table ZTEST111, in which ZTEST111 has 4 primary keys including MANDT, RBUKRS, BELNR, DOCLN. So I need to validate an

              IF ls_field_info-reftable IS NOT INITIAL
                AND ls_excel_line-value IS NOT INITIAL.

                DATA: lv_check_tab   TYPE tabname,
                      lv_excel_value TYPE string,
                      lt_pk_fields   TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF dfies,
                      ls_keyinfo     LIKE LINE OF lt_pk_fields,
                      lv_exists      TYPE abap_bool,
                      lv_where       TYPE string.

                CLEAR: lt_pk_fields, lv_exists.
                lv_check_tab = ls_field_info-reftable.
                lv_excel_value = condense( ls_excel_line-value ).

                "1. Get the list of fields that are the primary key of the table
                CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_FIELDINFO_GET'
                  EXPORTING
                    tabname        = lv_check_tab
                    langu          = sy-langu
                    all_types      = abap_false
                  TABLES
                    dfies_tab      = lt_pk_fields
                  EXCEPTIONS
                    not_found      = 1
                    internal_error = 2
                    OTHERS         = 3.

                IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR lt_pk_fields IS INITIAL.
                  "Unable to get metadata => error
                  MESSAGE s025(zsap03_msg_cl) WITH lv_check_tab INTO lv_msg.
                  APPEND lv_msg TO lt_errors.
                  IF <lv_has_error> IS ASSIGNED.
                    <lv_has_error> = abap_true.
                  ENDIF.
                  lv_has_errors = abap_true.
                  CONTINUE.
                ENDIF.

                "2. Browse each field that is the primary key
                LOOP AT lt_pk_fields INTO ls_keyinfo WHERE keyflag = 'X'.

                  CLEAR: lv_exists, lv_where.

                  " WHERE: <primary_key_field> = value
                  CONCATENATE ls_keyinfo-fieldname '= _excel_value' INTO lv_where SEPARATED BY space.

                  TRY.
                      SELECT SINGLE 
                        FROM (lv_check_tab)
                        WHERE (lv_where)
                        INTO _exists.
                    CATCH cx_sy_dynamic_osql_semantics INTO DATA(lx_sql_error).
                      "If errors
                      MESSAGE lx_sql_error->get_text( ) TYPE 'S'.
                      MESSAGE s023(zsap03_msg_cl)
                        WITH ls_excel_line-row lv_excel_value lv_check_tab ls_keyinfo-fieldname
                        INTO lv_msg.
                      APPEND lv_msg TO lt_errors.
                      IF <lv_has_error> IS ASSIGNED.
                        <lv_has_error> = abap_true.
                      ENDIF.
                      lv_has_errors = abap_true.
                      CONTINUE.
                  ENDTRY.

                  IF lv_exists = abap_true.
                    "Assign a name to the found field
                    IF <lv_field> IS ASSIGNED.
                      <lv_field> = ls_keyinfo-fieldname.
                    ENDIF.
                    EXIT."If found, no need to check
                  ENDIF.

                ENDLOOP.

                "3. If not found in any PK field → error
                IF lv_exists IS INITIAL.
                  MESSAGE e026(zsap03_msg_cl)
                    WITH ls_excel_line-row lv_excel_value lv_check_tab 'Primary Key fields'
                    INTO lv_msg.
                  APPEND lv_msg TO lt_errors.
                  IF <lv_has_error> IS ASSIGNED.
                    <lv_has_error> = abap_true.
                  ENDIF.
                  lv_has_errors = abap_true.
                  CONTINUE.
                ENDIF.
              ENDIF.

entry.title: Re: Unify ECC and NetWeaver HCM during the S/4HANA conver...
entry.content:
Hi @AndersonCM 

Thank you for your query regarding the planned system conversion from SAP ECC to S/4HANA, alongside the unification of your standalone SAP HCM system.

First it is important to know that your successful implementation will require some steps which will include:

  • Creating a technical overview, where you address topics like Brownfield of ECC to S/4HANA. This will focus on system conversion, data configuration and software updates.
  • Ensuring the upgrade readiness of your SAP ERP HCM through SAP HCM for S/4HANA (H4S4) and SuccessFactors path.
  • Please note, Compatibility Mode for HCM on S/4HANA ends December 31, 2025; beyond that, standalone classic HCM cannot be run on the same S/4HANA instance.

The following technical approach recommended by SAP ensures a smooth Technical Unification:

  1. Considering you are using a brownfield system conversion upgrade of your ECC landscape to S/4HANA, ensure to use Software Update Manager (SUM) and adhere to SAP's readiness checks and simplification item reviews.
  2. Separately migrate your standalone NetWeaver HCM system to SAP HCM for S/4HANA (H4S4), and integrate it as a sidecar or within the S/4HANA environment. This will depend on your chosen deployment model and business requirements.
  3. Carefully align master data and payroll/time schemas via SAP migration tools, make sure to consider the end of “compatibility mode” for classic HCM by December 31, 2025. After this date, HCM must run as H4S4 or transition to SuccessFactors.

To ease the process, please ensure both systems meet SAP’s technical prerequisites and leverage SAP Notes 2502552 and 2399707 for functional and custom code compatibility assessment. A detailed analysis and project plan should precede the technical conversion steps, with dedicated testing for all HR processes and data integrations.

Conversion Guide for SAP S/4HANA

SAP Note Simplification Item Check implementation problems

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: ITALY CU Withholding tax vendor form by e-mail
entry.content:
In practice you must wire three areas together: the FI‐output control, the vendor’s e-mail contact, and the SAPconnect (SCOT/PPF) infrastructure. Here’s a step-by-step:

SPRO → Financial Accounting → Accounts Payable → Business Transactions → Withholding Tax → Basic Settings → Output Determination. Under Application choose WT (Withholding Tax), then click Output Types. For your CU certificate output type (e.g. J3B), ensure:

  • Medium = 5 (External Send; i.e. e-mail)
  • Program = the delivered print program (e.g. RJ3B_CU_COVER)
  • Form = your Adobe/SmartForm layout (e.g. SAPLWT10, form CUI_CERT)

Under Partner Determination click Receiver and add partner function (e.g. ‘VN’ for vendor). Under Output Control Rules, maintain your condition record so that the output type is triggered for the proper company code, tax code, or document type.

Go to the vendor master (BP transaction or FK03). In the Partner tab → select partner function that you used in the output type (e.g. ‘VN’), and click Contact Persons. Edit the contact person data and maintain:

  • Communication method = 0005 (E-Mail)
  • E-Mail address in the “E-Mail” field
  • Flag Default so it’s the first candidate.

Save your changes.

Transaction SCOT → choose Node “SMTP” → click Activate. Double-click the SMTP node → Settings tab → maintain your mail host (SMTP server) and a valid Sender address. On the Options tab, ensure “Send Later” is unchecked if you want immediate dispatch. Save and press Test Connection to confirm SAP can reach the mail server.
